He assumes that the bounty hunter was a pale man with dark hair,even though there is nothing that indicates that.Not to mention that the "pale man" is obviously death itself already,with the whole "everyone must meet this man,so they shunned him",so it doesn't make sense for the pale man to be merely a killer.

Okay, no.  I'm sorry, but no.  I hate when people talk about Kindred being Jhin (But hey, maybe it's a legit theory that I just haven't heard all of).  Look, Jhin and Kindred are associated with each other because of this:  Riot wanted to make a "Bounty Hunter" character, so they first thought up this cyborg cowboy guy who could collect bounties on other champs (and maybe jungle monster, I dunno).  Originally, his ult was going to be a near-global range Lux ult with a tiny hitbox.  If you were able to land this on a "Bountied" champ, it would be an insta-kill.  This eventually just became Jhin's E.  Anyway, they iceboxed Jhin.  While working on Kindred, they decided that the bounty system worked better with them, so they took it from Jhin and gave it to Kindred.  

If they share similar quotes it's probably an easter egg or reference to this relationship.

Zed probably screamed because having shadow spirits invade your mind and force you to kill your father to defend their anchor is not exactly a comfortable experience.

The LeBlanc reflection thingy was an aborted story arc where Noxus had her infiltrate Demacia, abduct, and replace Prince Jarvan for some sinister purpose, but it appears to have been retconned along with all the original Summoners/Institute of War lore.

Kindred and Jhin have no connection except that they both wear masks. The former is Valoran's embodiment of Death and the latter is a serial murderer who makes modern art out of his victims.

There are 3 possiblities I can think of about Zed's scream.

* Someone was there with Master Kusho and happened a case that Zed couldn't stop. It ended with Master Kusho's death and he screamed. Even while he was broken emotionally at this moment, he wanted to look no weak and used this murdering for his purpose.

* He tried to defend himself but killed him accidently. Same as the first possibility, he used it for his benefit while he regreted a lot.

* Master Kusho killed himself for some reasons and Zed (again) used this.

Zed's scream %90 surely explains his love for Master Kusho in his deep soul. He doesn't want to look weak so he never shows his this side.
